body: I'm not usually a person to say this but: let's make this message platform dependent instead of enumerating the platforms here.
@laanwj #ifdef Q_OS_MAC it?
Improved the code to use an ifdef for OSX instead.

Possible suggestion: ```c++ #ifdef Q_OS_MAC QString clearKeyStr = "Ã¢ÂÂcmd-L"; #else QString clearKeyStr = "Ctrl-L"; #endif ... tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and %1 to clear screen.").arg(clearKeyStr) + "
" + ``` After all: - The key is not to be translated - Also gets rid of the HTML formatting in the translation string in one go
diff_hunk:
@@ -731,8 +731,12 @@ void RPCConsole::clear(bool clearHistory) ); message(CMD_REPLY, (tr("Welcome to the %1 RPC console.").arg(tr(PACKAGE_NAME)) + "
" + - tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and Ctrl-L to clear screen.") + "
" + - tr("Type help for an overview of available commands.")) + +#ifdef Q_OS_MAC + tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and Ã¢ÂÂcmd-L to clear screen.") + "
" + +#else + tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and Ctrl-L to clear screen.") + "
" + +#endif + tr("Type help for an overview of available commands.")) +

body:
If we are already bikeshedding:
Alternative suggestion would be adding `QString generalFunctionKey()` to platformstyles.cpp.
Then use something like `tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and %1-L to clear screen.").arg(platformStyle->generalFunctionKey())`

body: I guess you can also do `arg(""+platformStyle->generalFunctionKey()+"")` to avoid html in translatable strings.

body: Yes, adding it to platformStyle would be another step further, I didn't want to suggest that here to not make life too difficult for @spencerlievens while also not making life harder for translators by adding another message that is almost-the-same.

body: @laanwj When I find some time I will add to platformstyle.cpp and update the translation files as it isn't difficult, just time consuming.
There is a TAB on this otherwise empty line.
Can you please move this HTML down to `arg(clsKey)`? E.g. ```C++ arg(""+clsKey+) ``` or something and remove it from here?
Spaces replaced by TABs? Why?
Urgh that was my editor.
Done

All squashed and good to go ;)
